keyword: how many calories in two fried eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in Two Fried Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in two fried eggs, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Two Fried Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), fried sunny-side up in 1 tsp total oil or butter, lightly salted.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying fat amount, cooking time, and added seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two large fried eggs offer ~185 kcal and ~13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tbsp extra oil total
No added fat (pan-fried dry or poached)

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in two fried eggs?
Do fried eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fat; fried adds ~14 kcal per egg vs. boiled.

faqs.q: How does frying method affect calories?
faqs.a: More oil or butter increases fat and calories; minimal fat keeps it closer to boiled.

faqs.q: Are fried eggs high in cholesterol?
faqs.a: Yes, two provide ~372 mg, mostly from yolks; consider dietary needs.
